ygData.subject: Re: Neo Beast Wars
ygData.msgSnippet: Tavatron didn t back down this time, she knew Dinobot was upset, and he had a right to be, but she knew that slagging this new bot without hesistation

Subject: Re: Neo Beast Wars
Date: Mon, 12 Jun 2000 16:48:45 EDT
Mime-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; format=flowed
From: "FIRE FOX" <firefox_y2k@...>

Tavatron didn't back down this time, she knew Dinobot was upset, and he had 
a right to be, but she knew that slagging this new 'bot without hesistation 
wouldn't help matters. Tavatron returned Dinobot's gaze, but there was no 
anger in her optics, they were emotionless, a technique she had perfected 
many cycles ago, and one she had vowed to never use again. She didn't like 
appearing cold and heartless as she once had been. The perfect warrior, 
attacking without hesistation, now weakened by compasion and feelings. Well, 
that was what she had been told.

Tavatron watched as Dinobot drew his own fluid once again. She didn't like 
it when he hurt himself like that, though she was pretty sure it caused him 
no real pain, it still pained her to see him like this. Why was he so full 
of rage?

Tavatron stopped thinking about Dinobot and snapped back to reality when 
Cyber Claw screeched, her own warrior instincts kicking in. Tavatron watched 
as Cyber Claw took to the air and lashed out at Dinobot, this was defenitely 
not going well.

Tavatron let Cyber Claw shoulder past her, the spikes on Cyber Claw's 
shoulder almost piercing her organic skin. Tavatron instinctively sheathed 
her sword and unsheathed her staff, holding it in a fighting stance in front 
of her. Striker may not want a fight, and neither did she, but this new 'bot 
was going to be a different story:

"Please, whoever you are, just relax. All we want to do is talk."

This situation was getting out of hand. Tavatron looked at Striker, his own 
weapons drawn. She then looked at Dinobot, her eyes pleading for him not to 
do anything rash, thought by now even she may be unable to convince him to 
do otherwise.
